intro: Ebnerella insularis, commonly known as the island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
